comments.value:
As discussed earlier today:

We need a password protection solution to stop the general public accessing the ATOS application form for the first period of specialist applications.

The (ATOS-built) volunteering application form will not be available for the launch of the programme on 27 July. Only ‘specialist’ volunteer groups e.g. medics, translators, will be able to apply at that stage, with the general public applying in mid September via  a link from the main website. 

To ensure that only specialist groups apply, we want to have a page with a username/password entry form, which will stand alone from the rest of the volunteering site. We will circulate the link to this page, plus the uname/password to members of the specialist groups. There will only be up to 10 separate uname/password combinations – one for each specialist group.

If users successfully input the uname/password into the form, they would then be allowed to pass through to the volunteering application form.

If users get the password/uname wrong, they would need to see an error message.

ATOS are also suggesting that our page would issue a cookie which they would check to ensure that only  people who had input the correct uname/password were accessing the form.

In our meeting on Tues we’d like to look at how feasible the above is to do given the timeline. We’d ideally like it to be ready by 9 June but I appreciate that time is not on our side...
Date set to July 27. Priority set to high.
Jamie, I am assuming that "as discussed earlier today" means with you. Assigned to you for now.
Yes I need to respond to Morag with a proposal / cost, I think we can work largely independent from ATOS on this.
Note new due date: June 9.
Speac attached..
Jamie says it's authorized - I'm looking at it now.

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/early-registration/index.php

Things to know:
- edit (and republish) the page to add new passwords for different categories. there's an editable intro box as well.
- I've put in the same throttle as the access now so that an user can't submit the form too often
- emails/passwords get saved to a database
Marking as solved.

To ensure that only specialist groups apply, we want to have a page with a username/password entry form, which will stand alone from the rest of the volunteering site. We will circulate the link to this page, plus the uname/password to members of the specialist groups. There will only be up to 10 separate uname/password combinations – one for each specialist group.

If users successfully input the uname/password into the form, they would then be allowed to pass through to the volunteering application form.

If users get the password/uname wrong, they would need to see an error message.

comments.value:
As mentioned to Jamie yesterday, we have a requirement for a NEW element of the Volunteering section. This takes the form of an accessible / 'access now' form sitting on our main site, which will provide an accessible short form allowing users of screen readers and other vision impairment technology to submit an application. The application will be received by our Call Centre, who will call the person back and help them to submit the full application on the ATOS application form.

The intention is to provide an alternative to the actual application form (a system built by ATOS) which has some shortcomings from an accessibility point of view (particularly screenreaders).

I attach a Powerpoint showing the core requirements for this form. It's pretty simple: the fields are itemised on page 4. The main requirement is that the coding is fully accessible, properly marked up etc. We would also want icons with tooltips to provide additional help - see the form laid out here (it is a mock-up of the ATOS form, but shows the icons with tooltips):  http://locog.metroserver.co.uk/ We would also ask AbilityNet to work closely with you in order to test the form and ensure it is watertight. We can also work with McCann to design up this page (if you think that preferable). 

In terms of timings, this needs to be ready with the rest of the Volunteering site to be tested from 9 June, so it's not a huge amount of time.

What I would like from you at this stage is a quote indicating as closely as you can the cost of doing this piece of work. Would it be possiblet to have something by close of play tomorrow?

Happy to answer any questions or discuss further! Many thanks - Morag
Set a provisional date for the delivery of the quote for the end of next week, April 23rd.

Ooh, Jamie said he would do it by close of play today if possible? It's
quite urgent

 

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
23rd Floor, One Churchill Place
London E14 5LN
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 160
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012 
www.youtube.com/london2012  

 

________________________________
Oh, dear. It looks like it might have to wait until tomorrow. I have re-set the due date.

Hi Morag,

Sorry for the delay on getting back to you on this,

I'd imagine it would 3 days to cover talking to Ability.net, implementation of the form,a mechanism to stop the form being abused and the actual sending of the form. Plus testing, integration, tweaks etc. (the actual coding will probably  turn out to be the smallest part of the work, but the more parties involved the more these things tend to eat up time, hence why I have priced this a day more than we may normally have to cover tweaks, emails, questions, interrogation, panics :) etc. 

But a couple of questions:

- Will the form be largely based largely on the Atos one http://locog.metroserver.co.uk/ (but re-coded form scratch to deal with accessibility issues) 

- Will Ability.net supply the initial recommendations upfront? 

- Do we just need to send a single email to the call center (will the confirmation email and the rest of the sign-up be handled by the call center?)

- Do you need an accessible Captcha? (I knwo that was the issue with original form so expect not). Therefore if we drop the Captcha, I assume you'd want us to limiting the registrations to one email (sent to the call center) per email address /  limit the number of uses by one machine/IP address.


thanks

Jamie

Hi Morag,

As per our conversation:

- Kitsite to build form based of look and feel of exiting form with input from Ability.net
- Drop Captcha
- Add in check for multiple request form the same address
- Email to be send to both call center and user
- Integration and testing

6 days

ps. One thing I forgot to check is if it is OK for us to host the page and script that sends the emails / stores the submitted details on the www.london2012.com server/domain [but use the branding from the volunteer site]. The reason I suggest this is that is may be more complex / time consuming to host the form page on the ATOS' server and if we do it on the www. server we have full control. We could always redirect the user back to the ATOS/volunteer site after the alternative sign-up process.

Thanks, Jamie. I should have an answer by Weds as to whether we can
proceed.

RE: your PS, happy to host the page and script on london2012.com rather
than the ATOS servers.

Have a lovely evening!

Morag

 

________________________________

Just to update you: we are happy to proceed with this. I will send you a definitive list of fields for the form tomorrow. 

For billing purposes, could you ensure this piece of work is kept separate from the retainer as it will be a separate PO? Thank you!
Set to authorized with due date of June 9th.

comments.value:
Hello

I am trying to create a filter in the UMS which has all the Volunteers who have signed up since 27/01/2010. I thought I could do this based on the data in Communicator, but the 'Date created' field is actually the date added to Communicator, not the date the record was created in our UMS. As we didn't send the records across to Communicator until Feb, this means that I can't use 'Date created'. Is it possible therefore to create an export from the UMS of everyone who has signed up for Volunteering since 27 January? I will then import that into the UMS Volunteering list with an extra field which will allow me to segment based on sign-up date. Could this be done in the next 48 hours?
having a look now

Unfortunately there's no date field (except for the CC import date as you pointed out). Things we can do:

1. export the list of users that have -registered- after 27/01/2010 and are subscribed to the volunteering stuff
2. add a -registered- field to the current database

We have no date tag attached to changing subscription preferences. (and being a volunteer is essentially subscribing to the volunteering newsletter in an UMS sense)

The first option is ~two hours of Kieran's work, the second is half an hour of mine - but takes a bit short of 48 (~40) hours to propagate on Communicator Corp database.

Hi Janos

I think the first option is best in the long term, so I would like to do that so it’s set up there for us to use going forwards.

Is it possible to schedule this in within the next two days?

Many thanks!

Morag

Morag,

I really hope you meant the 'second option is best in the long term' - that's what I started running just minutes ago. creationDate field should be populated in the next two days (4000 done, 500.000 to go :).

Anyway, if it's running slow, or you still need a custom, one-off export from the UMS, just shout.
Janos – that is exactly what I meant. Thank you for being a mind reader – as well as hyper-efficient!

Hi Janos

Has this work been done now? Will Communicator have updated yet?

Thanks

Hello,

Only a couple of thousands missing - should be finished in an hour or two, I'm just waiting for the feed email to arrive.

Thank you – will you let me know when it is done? We want to send our email out tomorrow.

Thanks!
I just received a confirmation email from the script - every record should now have a creationDate field.
Marking as solved.

Hi Liz,

(sorry I know you just want me to say one day, or less and be done 
with it !)

But before I even answer this it woudl be good to clear up what 
location values we are talking about, I'm confused so I am sure the OW 
team must be !

Looking at this event:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/editform/events/fenland-stories.php

There are several 'location' fields:

1) Firstly there are two region fields, any idea why?

The one at the top is a pull down and one is a text field although the 
second seems to be filled in more? I'll expect you'll answer no, was 
hoping you could explain that...

<content:select id="eventRegion" title="Region" isMetaData="true" 
taxonomy="regions" />
<content:string id="region" title="Region" taxonomy="regions" 
isMetaData="true"/>

#SuggestedSolution#: Maybe we can just consolidate these into one 
field? I assume both regions relate to the event not the organiser.

2) We then have these three fields which seem to refer to the venue 
the event is being held at, is the event location and venue location 
the same thing?

<content:string id="location" title="Location" taxonomy="locations" 
isMetaData="true"/>
<content:string id="county" title="County" isMetaData="true" />
<content:string id="venueBorough" title="Venue borough" 
isMetaData="true" taxonomy="boroughs" />

#Clarification#

3) Once we have got to the bottom of the above there is the question 
of locations vs regions, regions just seem to be a subset of location.

Regions: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/_system/taxonomy/regions.xml
Location: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/_system/taxonomy/locations.xml

#Root cause#: I expect what happened here, is that at some point the 
OW team requested a bigger set of 'locations/regions' than the current 
regions.xml taxonomy contained. So Marna added them in but then those 
extra values showed up in *ALL* region meta-data inputs on the site or 
in the CMS. So she created a new taxonomy called locations.xml just 
for the OW events.

#Problem#: The problem there is that we have i) two inputs that 
overlap each other ii) a new field 'location' that won't get related 
to articles tagged by 'region'.

#SuggestedSolution#:

We add the new fields to the region taxonomy and then live with the 
fact that those extra fields show up as options whenever region is 
available in the CMS.
We can drop Region and keep Location, but nothing will relate by 
region anymore.
We keep and consolidate down to Location (ie. a the wider region 
taxonomy) and /try/ to be clever and always save off a value in a 
hidden Region field *if* the Location is contained in the region 
taxonomy (this may end up be more trouble / problematic than it's worth)

4) Back to the original question

After we have covered the above, we can back to the original question, 
but first a couple of questions:

- Which 'region' field are we looking at?

If we do the above (3) then we will now a single 'location' or 
'region' field which relates to a) the event (which is the same as 
venue?) b) the organiser's location - delete as appropriate.

- We have county field further down, Is this related? Should the above 
field sit above it? Is this the second field that is reduced when a 
'Region' (or Location is selected)

In terms of work, it looks like we actually need to do some clean up 
first.

But the actual implementation of the two pulldowns requires two things:

a) Turn both the region (or location) and country fields into pull 
downs, which should be fairly easy (we need to do it on the OW form, 
the event form and the CMS screen)
b) Add in some Javascript functionality (and a config file) to tie the 
two fields together.

If we limit (b) to the frontend (not the CMS *) then it actually makes 
life simpler, the only tricky thing is that because we already use the 
region and county taxonomies in their current format elsewhere in the 
CMS we will have to upkeep a 3rd file which contains information about 
both taxonomies and their nesting. As the region/country values are 
unlikely to change? this is probably isn't an issue, but in other 
cases / other fields it may be.

Anyway I think I probably replied with more questions than answers, 
but hopefully at the end we'll have a better Events system and I be 
able to more clearly tell you how long a two step pull down for Region/ 
County would take (**)

Thanks !

Jamie

* the form used to edit Events in the CMS is a generic editor, it's 
not a special interface just for editing events, therefore we can't 
easily add custom functionality, like a two step pull down. We could 
build a custom screen/interface for events but we'd be into the 3/4 
days or work area, so I won't even suggest it.

** I expect it would be a days work (or just under) to get the pull 
down working properly across both forms. But it looks like we will 
also need to spend some time on some clean up / consolidation (will 
have a better idea of the work involved here after we have discussed 
the above)

Jamie,

 

First of all - I warned them this might not be an easy piece of work!
So if it's more than one day, that's fine!

 

1) I would love it if there was only one region field. There's always
been two in the back end, and I've *never* understood why!

2) Last year we were collecting information on both the event address
and the venue address. That's clearly a silly thing to do, so this year
we're only collecting information on venue address - so the other is
excessive. As for the word 'location' see below.

3) The meta-data on location is something we're actually looking to get
rid of, if you check the ticket about updating the metadata - it's just
not something we really use, and would prefer to use free-text tags
instead. In general, though, the region should be a drop down box with
the 13 official Nations and Regions in it.

 

I have to say the rest of your email confused me a bit. Do those
answers clear things up enough that you can re-propose a solution?
What's probably MUCH more helpful is to look at the actual event form on
the front end - that's the information we actually want to be
collecting. The way these fields match up in the back-end has always
confused me a bit. Right now, we just have a drop down to select a
region. (see screen grab below) What we want adding is another drop
down box that is populated with counties dependent upon whichever region
is selected. I hope that's clear?

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Sorry, that response was half notes to myself as I was thinking though the issues (naughty me!)

1) Regions/Locations/Madness

What was going on there ;-) My fault for not keeping a closer eye on Marna, although I expect at the time it was done with the best intent / reason. Something way probably asked for and rather than push back and say "we need to approach this requirement a different way" Marna just took the literal route.

Anyway Janos and myself spent afternoon discussing this, looking at what we had, how we could consolidate it.

Good news !!!

We think we can collapse them all down to a single 'Region' (13 regions) field, some Locations had Borough but we can push then into the Borough field, I think we may have a dozen that need to be handled by hand. But YEAH! we can have just one Region filed.

We're just going to do this, in fact that is what Janos is going today.

I don't think we can charge you for this,I just wanted it tidied up before we did anything else here, but brownie points for doing it would be accepted ;-) 

2) Event address

Can we drop legacy event address data, assuming we have venue data (if we don't we can move it across) ? It's just lots of legacy unused fields is just hording and causes confusion.

If so we'll remove all traces of it (and do clean up if required)

3) With the above no clear in my mind (sorry should have been clear first time round).

- We convert the new consolidated 'Region' and 'Counties' fields to a pulldowns.

- We add the two stage / cascading pull down to the public form (we can't do this in the CMS the second will just contain all values as it currently does)

- We'll need the correlation between Regions -> Counties (lets talk best format separately, if you don't already have as a single file)

To code,deploy, test the above will take a day.

Jamie

1) 27 brownie points given. You can even have chocolate ones. I'm not
eating chocolate this month - so it's a special treat. :-)

 

2) I need to make sure that the legacy stuff the event address is the
less important field. Was it event or org address that we were
collecting? I just want to make sure we don't lose the actual address
(the one that gets sent through to the map). In fact, can you just
confirm which that is? The other legacy one should be ok to remove.

 

3) Helpful. I can send you the dependency list separately and that will
all be clear. 

 

And the day quote is also helpful. I will feed back to the team and
check if they want to do it (they might not, so don't get too carried
away!)

 

Thanks, Jamie.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012

comments.value:
- we need to figure out some way of letting ppl pick only the 23rd, 24th, or 25th, if they select open weekend (maybe tick boxes)

Please see previous conversation on this ticket here, but reply via this ticket
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/797

1) we need to figure out some way of letting ppl pick only the 23rd, 24th, or 25th, if they select open weekend (maybe tick boxes)

We don't actually have that information on the event or the submission form in any structured format (we have start /end date)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/open-weekend/information-for-event-organisers/submit-an-event/index.php

We could in theory add three new check boxes for Open weekend Sat [x] | Sun [ ] | Mon [x] (although someone would need to go back and fill them in by hand) but these would be flags and not dates (in terms of search by dates).

This means we could use them to visually flag up particular events as Sat/Sun/Mon/All and in addition we could add two new check boxes under the normal search options (Saturday only [ ] Sunday only [ ]) when Open weekend is selected that limited events to just that day, we'd also need to get these to remember the submitted values and auto check those boxes when the page is submitted.

None of the above is trivial and without issue:

a) all events will end up with these three new check boxes, given the amount of OW fields already on the Events page maybe two more isn't going to break the camels back
b) someone will need to fix up all the existing events
c) we'll need to update the OW submission form, the code that handles form submissions and the event page itself.
d) we'll need to add new check boxes (and sort out the css/layout) for them to the search form and make sure they only appear when OpenWeeknd option is selected); we'll also need to make these boxes auto check when a search is performed.
e) we'll need to change the search engine to take account of the three new boxes and then limit the results to Open Weekend events with with the Sat or Sun checkboxes.
f) this field won't actually affect any date searches (as it's not a date field it's just a flag; probably not an immediate issue, just means that events will stil have to be given a start/end date as they currently are)
f) develop on dev, test, deploy to live and test some more

All in all at least a days work.

Jamie
Set to high. Still pending.

I'm a bit confused on this.  Might be worth talking about.  We would never have an event on just the sat and then the monday.  either it's inclusive (so fri-sun or fri-sat) or just one day.  How is what we've got with start/end date terribly different to that?

Did our conversation the other day help clear this up at all?

Hi Liz,

OK that makes it simpler as (as you say) we already have the start / 
end date, so the data model and the submit for statys the same.

We just need to add some check boxes to the search form (as we're 
sharing the same search for normal events, I assume you only want them 
to show when OW is selected as the event date)

We then need to add some new logic to the back end to filter the 
searches by those check boxes (and maybe pre check them in the results)

Jamie

Hi Jamie,

, I assume you only want them
to show when OW is selected as the event date) --> yes, please

And yes, again.

Could you quote? I’d like them to pay for it.

1 day to make changes, test and deploy.

I know I originally said one day for the more complex route, but we are finding that even though the development work on events may only take 3/4 of a day we are spending at least another 1/4 of a day on handover, questions, post launch questions, clarifications etc. [ie. non dev stuff] and need to recoup some of that time, especially as currently the time we have spent on events far outweighs what we have billed you so far, I hope you understand.

thanks 

Jamie
Fine! I’ll let them know, and see if they really want it. ☺
I still need to chase OW team on this... I'm working on it!
Right!  They would like this, please.  Separate PO for £700

Am marking this ticket as closed.
The new functionality is as follows:
On all pages that display "related events", a search is made for: "All upcoming events which match one or more of this page's metadata". If any are found then we display a "Related events" heading, and up to 4 related events, ordered by date.
If none is found then we simply display an old-style "Upcoming events" heading, followed by up to 4 /upcoming/ events, irrespective of location or theme, ordered by date.
For example, if you visit the following page

http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/03/more-than-10-000-businesses-engaged-on-london-2012-opportunities.php

You'll see that it displays three =related= events:

1. http://www.london2012.com/events/london-business-network-event-stratford.php
2. http://www.london2012.com/events/international-youth-theatre-festival.php
3. http://www.london2012.com/events/london-business-network-event-central-london.php

These were found because they are tagged to theme:Business (1) & (3) or to region:East Midlands (2).

If, however, you visit the following page:

http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/05/london-2012-mascots-launched-to-the-world.php

You'll see that it simply displays 4 =upcoming= events. i.e. the next 4 events anywhere/tagged to anything. This is because this news article has no metadata. It just has a freetext:mascot tag.

I hope the above makes sense. If you have any questions, please ask.

As noted below, extending this functionality to news and photos should be possible, but should form a separate task.

Kieran
Danny, although actual days = 2, I think we should bill for one day, and then recoup the lost time if/when they request similar functionality for news/photos.

Hi Liz. I'm not sure what you mean. This functionality is live. Have you observed a problem with it?
Kieran.

I didn’t know it was live! So if I go in and add keywords to events, they’ll start to appear in related areas? Or is it only meta-themes it’s searching for? It still looks like all events are appearing on all pages? These events are clearly not related to funding...

[cid:image001.png@01CB0D3F.EFE516A0]

The page you sent 
  http://www.london2012.com/making-it-happen/funding-the-games/index.php
is not tagged with any metadata. Therefore the links that appear on the RHS are simply "Upcoming events", rather than "/Related/ events".
If you tag this page to a theme or a region, then it should start displaying /Related/ events.

(If you scroll back to my earlier comment, I tried to explain this in detail - obviously let me know if this is still unclear).

Sorry, Kieran – I didn’t see the zendesk update email and thus hadn’t realised you’d updated the ticket! That’s very clear. I’m wondering, though, if it would actually be better to *remove* upcoming events altogether. So if a page has no related events, display nothing, rather than updated ones. Is that easy to do? I just that users won’t notice the subtle difference in wording.

Can you please just clarify – is this only looking for the metadata themes (e.g. Culture, Sustainability, Basketball) or *all* keywords in the metadata (e.g. Seb Coe, athletes, etc) ?

Depending on the above, I think this is probably ideal for related news/blogs/photos/vids.

1. "Upcoming events". We could of course suppress this. Might it not look a bit empty if we did this though? Another option might be to /always/ display upcoming events, and then - if there are any - also display "related" events. Suppressing "Upcoming events" would be relatively simple - adding about 1/4 day to the actual days.

2. Currently it just searches on metadata. i.e. NOT on the freetext tags. This is - again - something we can change. it does involve a mass republication though. I estimate another 1/2 day to get this working.

3. news/blogs/photos/vids. What do you mean by "news" and "blogs" ?

4. Changing the "related photos" / "related videos" components to use this functionality would be 3/4 day each. I know I said 1/2 day each, below, but I have since realised that I will have to perform a mass republication, and also that they're not just simple text links like the related events.

I hope this makes sense.

Kieran

1) We’ve gotten feedback that just having random upcoming, unrelated events on lots of pages is more distracting than helpful. So suppressing would be a good thing

2) It would be really good if we can have it work on freetext tags – Jamie’s original concern was that it would significantly slow down load time – is that no longer the case?

3) At the bottom of all pages we have related news and blogs. These work just like pictures and video at the moment – only related news/blogs appear, but you have to republish the page in order for it to take effect. My understanding of what you’ve done for events is that we would no longer have to republish an individual page in order for the most recent related content (right now just events) to be picked up

4) Unclear how the type of content would affect things, but otherwise understood.

1. Ok. This will go live when I deploy 2,3,4.

I'm leaving 1. on this ticket.
For 2,3,4 I'm creating a new ticket.
